name: Entity Identifier
description: The EI data type is used to specify the identifier for an entity. It provides a comprehensive structure for uniquely identifying entities with both local identifiers and universal identifiers. The EI data type combines a namespace identifier (for local use) with a universal identifier and its type, enabling flexible identification schemes that work both locally and globally.

EI.1.name: Entity Identifier
EI.1.description: The actual identifier value for the entity. This is the unique identifier within the specified namespace.

EI.2.name: Namespace ID
EI.2.description: Identifies the namespace in which the identifier is unique. Specifies the context or system that assigned the identifier.

EI.3.name: Universal ID
EI.3.description: A unique identifier that is universal across all systems. Formatted according to the scheme defined by the Universal ID Type.

EI.4.name: Universal ID Type
EI.4.description: Specifies the format and interpretation rules for the Universal ID component. Defines the naming system used for the universal identifier.

populationRules: At least one of EI.1 or EI.3 must be populated
If EI.4 is present, EI.3 must also be present
EI.2 provides context for EI.1 when present
constraints.uniqueness: The combination of identifier and namespace must be unique within the specified context

usage: System identifiers for applications and devices
Instance identifiers for various healthcare entities
commonFields: Instance identifiers in various HL7 segments

generationHints.typical: Use realistic entity identifiers appropriate for healthcare equipment and systems
generationHints.patterns: Combine descriptive local identifiers with universal identification where needed
generationHints.context: Ensure identifiers are appropriate for the entity type being identified

identificationModes.localOnly: EI.1 and optionally EI.2 - local identifier with namespace
identificationModes.universalOnly: EI.3 and EI.4 - universal identifier with type
identificationModes.hybrid: All components - both local and universal identification
identificationModes.minimal: EI.1 only - simple identifier without namespace

namespaceExamples.documents: Clinical document management and transcription systems

validationRules.universalIDConsistency: Universal ID Type must match the format of Universal ID
validationRules.namespaceValidation: Namespace ID should reference valid table values when applicable
validationRules.lengthConstraints: All components must respect their maximum length limitations

implementationNotes.extensibility: Can accommodate various identification schemes and standards
